toolkit.domain

Class GcWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • toolkit.domain.GcWindow

  • public class GcWindow
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by James Euesden on 2/15/2016. Represents a window of the contiguous read for use in the GC Content calculation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int _cCount 
      private int _gCount 
      private java.lang.String _windowContent 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GcWindow(java.lang.String windowContent)
      Initialized with the characters of the particular window this GcWindow represents.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void calculateCounts()
      Counts the number of Gs and Cs within the window.
      int getCCount()
      Returns the number of 'G' characters in the window.
      int getGCount()
      Returns the number of 'G' characters in the window.
      int getWindowContentSize()
      Returns the length of this window, based on the size of the String that has the characters of the window.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GcWindow

        public GcWindow(java.lang.String windowContent)
        Initialized with the characters of the particular window this GcWindow represents. Calculates the G and C counts as soon as the window is created. As the window content won't change, this can be done now and doesn't need to be recounted every time the counts are requested.
        Parameters:
        windowContent - The characters of the window.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateCounts

        Counts the number of Gs and Cs within the window.

        Returns the number of 'G' characters in the window.
        Returns:

      • getWindowContentSize

        public int getWindowContentSize()
        Returns the length of this window, based on the size of the String that has the characters of the window.
        Returns:
        The length of this window, based on the size of the String that has the characters of the window.
